verses.verse: Now the serpent <S%H5175><s%> was more subtle <S%H6175><s%> than any <S%H3605><s%> beast <S%H2416><s%> of the field <S%H7704><s%> which <S%H834><s%> the LORD <S%H3068><s%> God <S%H430><s%> had made. <S%H6213><s%> And he said <S%H559><s%> to the woman, <S%H802><s%> Yes, <S%H637><s%> <S%H3588><s%> has God <S%H430><s%> said, <S%H559><s%> You shall not eat <S%H398><s%> of every <S%H3605><s%> tree <S%H6086><s%> of the garden? <S%H1588><s%>
And the woman <S%H802><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to the serpent, <S%H5175><s%> We may eat <S%H398><s%> of the fruit <S%H6529><s%> of the trees <S%H6086><s%> of the garden: <S%H1588><s%>

But of the fruit <S%H6529><s%> of the tree <S%H6086><s%> which <S%H834><s%> is in the middle <S%H8432><s%> of the garden, <S%H1588><s%> God <S%H430><s%> has said, <S%H559><s%> You shall not eat <S%H398><s%> of it, neither <S%H3808><s%> shall you touch <S%H5060><s%> it, lest <S%H6435><s%> you die. <S%H4191><s%>
And the serpent <S%H5175><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to the woman, <S%H802><s%> You shall not surely die: <S%H4191><s%>

For God <S%H430><s%> does know <S%H3045><s%> that in the day <S%H3117><s%> you eat <S%H398><s%> thereof, then your eyes <S%H5869><s%> shall be opened, <S%H6491><s%> and you shall be as gods, <S%H430><s%> knowing <S%H3045><s%> good <S%H2896><s%> and evil. <S%H7451><s%>

And when the woman <S%H802><s%> saw <S%H7200><s%> that the tree <S%H6086><s%> was good <S%H2896><s%> for food, <S%H3978><s%> and that it was pleasant <S%H8378><s%> to the eyes, <S%H5869><s%> and a tree <S%H6086><s%> to be desired <S%H2530><s%> to make one wise, <S%H7919><s%> she took <S%H3947><s%> of the fruit <S%H6529><s%> thereof, and did eat, <S%H398><s%> and gave <S%H5414><s%> also <S%H1571><s%> to her husband <S%H376><s%> with her; and he did eat. <S%H398><s%>

And the eyes <S%H5869><s%> of them both <S%H8147><s%> were opened, <S%H6491><s%> and they knew <S%H3045><s%> that they were naked; <S%H5903><s%> and they sewed <S%H8609><s%> fig <S%H8384><s%> leaves <S%H5929><s%> together, and made <S%H6213><s%> themselves <S%H1992><s%> aprons. <S%H2290><s%>

And they heard <S%H8085><s%> the voice <S%H6963><s%> of the LORD <S%H3068><s%> God <S%H430><s%> walking <S%H1980><s%> in the garden <S%H1588><s%> in the cool <S%H7307><s%> of the day: <S%H3117><s%> and Adam <S%H120><s%> and his wife <S%H802><s%> hid <S%H2244><s%> themselves from the presence <S%H6440><s%> of the LORD <S%H3068><s%> God <S%H430><s%> among <S%H8432><s%> the trees <S%H6086><s%> of the garden. <S%H1588><s%>
And the LORD <S%H3068><s%> God <S%H430><s%> called <S%H7121><s%> to Adam, <S%H120><s%> and said <S%H559><s%> to him, Where <S%H335><s%> are you?

And he said, <S%H559><s%> I heard <S%H8085><s%> your voice <S%H6963><s%> in the garden, <S%H1588><s%> and I was afraid, <S%H3372><s%> because <S%H3588><s%> I was naked; <S%H5903><s%> and I hid <S%H2244><s%> myself.

And he said, <S%H559><s%> Who <S%H4310><s%> told <S%H5046><s%> you that you were naked? <S%H5903><s%> Have you eaten <S%H398><s%> of the tree, <S%H6086><s%> whereof <S%H834><s%> I commanded <S%H6680><s%> you that you should not eat? <S%H398><s%>

And the man <S%H120><s%> said, <S%H559><s%> The woman <S%H802><s%> whom <S%H834><s%> you gave <S%H5414><s%> to be with me, she gave <S%H5414><s%> me of the tree, <S%H6086><s%> and I did eat. <S%H398><s%>

And the LORD <S%H3068><s%> God <S%H430><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to the woman, <S%H802><s%> What <S%H4100><s%> is this <S%H2063><s%> that you have done? <S%H6213><s%> And the woman <S%H802><s%> said, <S%H559><s%> The serpent <S%H5175><s%> beguiled <S%H5377><s%> me, and I did eat. <S%H398><s%>

And the LORD <S%H3068><s%> God <S%H430><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to the serpent, <S%H5175><s%> Because <S%H3588><s%> you have done <S%H6213><s%> this, <S%H2063><s%> you are cursed <S%H779><s%> above all <S%H3605><s%> cattle, <S%H929><s%> and above every <S%H3605><s%> beast <S%H2416><s%> of the field; <S%H7704><s%> on your belly <S%H1512><s%> shall you go, <S%H3212><s%> and dust <S%H6083><s%> shall you eat <S%H398><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> the days <S%H3117><s%> of your life: <S%H2416><s%>

And I will put <S%H7896><s%> enmity <S%H342><s%> between <S%H996><s%> you and the woman, <S%H802><s%> and between <S%H996><s%> your seed <S%H2233><s%> and her seed; <S%H2233><s%> it shall bruise <S%H7779><s%> your head, <S%H7218><s%> and you shall bruise <S%H7779><s%> his heel. <S%H6119><s%>

To the woman <S%H802><s%> he said, <S%H559><s%> I will greatly multiply <S%H7235><s%> your sorrow <S%H6093><s%> and your conception; <S%H2032><s%> in sorrow <S%H6089><s%> you shall bring <S%H3205><s%> forth <S%H3205><s%> children; <S%H1121><s%> and your desire <S%H8669><s%> shall be to your husband, <S%H376><s%> and he shall rule <S%H4910><s%> over you.

And to Adam <S%H121><s%> he said, <S%H559><s%> Because <S%H3588><s%> you have listened <S%H8085><s%> to the voice <S%H6963><s%> of your wife, <S%H802><s%> and have eaten <S%H398><s%> of the tree, <S%H6086><s%> of which <S%H834><s%> I commanded <S%H6680><s%> you, saying, <S%H559><s%> You shall not eat <S%H398><s%> of it: cursed <S%H779><s%> is the ground <S%H127><s%> for your sake; <S%H5668><s%> in sorrow <S%H6093><s%> shall you eat <S%H398><s%> of it all <S%H3605><s%> the days <S%H3117><s%> of your life; <S%H2416><s%>
Thorns <S%H6975><s%> also and thistles <S%H1863><s%> shall it bring <S%H6779><s%> forth <S%H6779><s%> to you; and you shall eat <S%H398><s%> the herb <S%H6212><s%> of the field; <S%H7704><s%>

In the sweat <S%H2188><s%> of your face <S%H639><s%> shall you eat <S%H398><s%> bread, <S%H3899><s%> till <S%H5704><s%> you return <S%H7725><s%> to the ground; <S%H127><s%> for out of it were you taken: <S%H3947><s%> for dust <S%H6083><s%> you are, and to dust <S%H6083><s%> shall you return. <S%H7725><s%>

And Adam <S%H120><s%> called <S%H7121><s%> his wife's <S%H802><s%> name <S%H8034><s%> Eve; <S%H2332><s%> because <S%H3588><s%> she was the mother <S%H517><s%> of all <S%H3605><s%> living. <S%H2416><s%>
To Adam <S%H120><s%> also and to his wife <S%H802><s%> did the LORD <S%H3068><s%> God <S%H430><s%> make <S%H6213><s%> coats <S%H3801><s%> of skins, <S%H5785><s%> and clothed <S%H3847><s%> them.

And the LORD <S%H3068><s%> God <S%H430><s%> said, <S%H559><s%> Behold, <S%H2005><s%> the man <S%H120><s%> is become <S%H1961><s%> as one <S%H259><s%> of us, to know <S%H3045><s%> good <S%H2896><s%> and evil: <S%H7451><s%> and now, <S%H6258><s%> lest <S%H6435><s%> he put <S%H7971><s%> forth <S%H7971><s%> his hand, <S%H3027><s%> and take <S%H3947><s%> also <S%H1571><s%> of the tree <S%H6086><s%> of life, <S%H2416><s%> and eat, <S%H398><s%> and live <S%H2425><s%> for ever: <S%H5769><s%>

Therefore the LORD <S%H3068><s%> God <S%H430><s%> sent <S%H7971><s%> him forth from the garden <S%H1588><s%> of Eden, <S%H5731><s%> to till <S%H5647><s%> the ground <S%H127><s%> from from where <S%H834><s%> <S%H8033><s%> he was taken. <S%H3947><s%>

So he drove <S%H1644><s%> out the man; <S%H120><s%> and he placed <S%H7931><s%> at the east <S%H6924><s%> of the garden <S%H1588><s%> of Eden <S%H5731><s%> Cherubim, <S%H3742><s%> and a flaming <S%H3858><s%> sword <S%H2719><s%> which turned <S%H2015><s%> every way, to keep <S%H8104><s%> the way of the tree <S%H6086><s%> of life. <S%H2416><s%>
